page.title: 03TIPPERARY INN
page.content: which has grassed over banks and roof. This underground reservoir is a single compartment,32m2 and 4.57m deep, and is capable of feeding Kenilworth and Warwick. {TIPPERARY INN.}This public house has a plaque which commerates the famous song "Its a long way to Tipperary" by Harry Williams.Inside the Pub, there are other souvenirs of the composer. The name was changed in 1940 from the Plough. Harry Williams wrote the song in the public bar in 1915.Another feature is an aquarium set into a piano.
